nodes.bodyText: Are these truly internal properties? Maybe there Redis module has it's own set of public properties.
Well, they exist... There is currently no way, I'm aware of, for a module to expose its own set of parameters. It would be nice to add that.

Firstly... the publicly accessible GemFire properties are under ConfigurationProperties... So adding them to an internal class is not really the answer.
Secondly, maybe as a Geode "extension" we need to add the ability to be able to extend our public properties list dependent on the extension. If that model does not exist, maybe it is safer to possibly not add the properties to an internal class (which the extension arguably should not have access to)..
Why not have an ExecutorPool rather than a specific list of Threads...
No particular reason. Is there any advantage of one over the other in such a simple situation? I can change it.

So, in short, seeing such a raw implementation of thread management is not something that I think we need to have. ExecutorPools are geared at managing threads and their lifecycles. Whilst I agree that this is a "simple" situation, I also agree that it is far easier to just have a payload(s) assigned to the an ExecutorPool.
Maybe not a gating factor.
Are these truly internal properties? Maybe there Redis module has it's own set of public properties.
